comment_text:
At 9:19, when we show the gauche and anti conformations, we accidentally changed the perspective when going from the bottom chair to the Newman projection for the anti conformation. As a challenge, try drawing the Newman projection of the chair on the bottom left of the screen looking down the marked bonds--you can check your work using our corrected image:
https://i.imgur.com/2DZtqRf.png

It’s tricky to visualize these 3D images, so kudos to our awesome viewer that caught this! Thank you for your continued support

I read the title as Cyclosexuals and I was like what the hell is that

ok I'll say it - cyclohexane is not a proper hexagon, exactly because of the puckering, that makes it 3d. Depending on perspective and conformation it can also look like a rhombus (chair) or a triangle (boat). If you made a graphene-like sheet with fused cyclohexane rings it would be all crinkled unlike the flat graphene with fused benzene rings.
